New Records: England chased Oman’s 47 in 3.1 overs – the largest win in men’s T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining
Key Match Events: England bowled Oman out in 13.2 overs for only 47, the fourth-lowest score at a T20 World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler, the England captain, had spoken about concentrating on the win first and foremost and not being consumed by run rates
Post-Match Reflections: The contest was done at the halfway mark, it was only a matter of how quickly England could complete the task and how far they could move the dial on their net run rate
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was finished in time for a sundowner
Others: In need of a mighty boost to their net run rate, England found the perfect opponents in hapless Oman, who were ripe for the plucking and were totally outclassed
